sourcesContent:
import { Container } from '../../style'; const CopyrightComplains = () => { return (

In the case that you think your work has been copied in a way that institutes copyright infringement, please contact us via{' '} customercare@tagpros.us . Here are the details that you should include in the document:

  • Email a document that contains the claimed copyright infringement to{' '} customercare@tagpros.us {' '} with the Subject Line: Copyright Infringement Report.
  • A description or copy of the copyrighted work that you believe violates the copyright infringement laws.
  • Location or link at which the material has been found.
  • Your name email address
  • Your physical or electronic signature.
  • A statement that you reported the material in good faith, meaning that you do not have any ill-intent in submitting the complaint.
  • A statement that the details included above is accurate.
  • A statement that you are the owner of the material that has been copied.

Once we have received your notification, we will investigate the material that was reported and will take action appropriate under the Philippine Copyright Law.

Appeals: If you have permission or believe that you did not violate any copyright laws, but your material has been removed or you have been accused of copyright infringement, you may submit a written appeal to{' '} customercare@tagpros.us . Here are the details that you should include in the document:

  • your physical or electronic signature;
  • A description or copy of the copyrighted work that has been reported for copyright infringement.
  • A statement that you did not copy the material in good faith, meaning that you do not have any ill-intent in submitting the complaint and that you believe the complaint was a mistake.
  • Your name and email address

If we receive a counter-notice from you, we will be escalating this to our review team and will process the necessary measures to republish the removed material within 10 business days if the appeal has been granted.{' '}

Multiple Violations: In the case that a teacher has been convicted of copyright infringement multiple times, we reserve the right to remove the teacher immediately from our platform. The process will be done on a case-to-case basis. However, we will make sure to give you a warning on your first violation.

); }; export default CopyrightComplains;
